content: Did #5802 get implemented or canceled?
@Sean Wallitsch I think I actually might have just hit the wrong button when commenting; it's certainly not implemented.
Are you folks excited about it? I don't think it'd be super hard, given that we already have the block-quote syntax.
I like the idea, but I worry a bit about complexity related to condense/collapse.
Yeah, well I think a basic version where you need to highlight it to see the text would be easy to do. We can always refine later as usage increases.

I put this in basically the same category as the /me does this feature, which I lobbied for to a degree and implemented V1 of. Empirically it gets very low usage on this realm, but it might delight a few users. What it definitely does is complicate the message-rendering code.

I'd be inclined to pay down some of our tech debt on the message-pane code before adding another feature like that. And, to be clear, I think this is a neat idea, so I'm only quibbling about priorities and timing.
Yeah, I don't think this is something I'd spend time on in the next month, but if someone's excited about it, I'd be fine with helping them do it.
(My question "Are you folks excited about it" was more for Sean)
(/me definitely is a periodic source of delight in some organizations, so I'm glad we have it!)
Naw, it's fairly low priority. We were trying to figure out if we could discuss Stranger Things in a topic and spoiler mark individual episodes.

We have a new spoilers feature!

You can read all the details here! Feedback is greatly appreciated, especially on how convenient these are.

The known issues are #15414 and #15416.

Please don't use this for anything that's actually a "spoiler" yet. #15416 means folks with desktop/email/mobile notifications will see the spoiler text raw, and in any case the mobile and terminal apps don't support this feature yet.

Testing, feedback, complaints and UX improvement PRs are much appreciated!
@Sean Wallitsch FYI :slight_smile:
I just tried clicking on the title, thinking it would open it.
(Ooh, I like the transition effect on the button.)
Great! I think that's confirmation that we need to expand the click area (which I'd already opened an issue for).
Also thanks to @Dylan Nugent and @Sara Gulotta for implementing this :slight_smile:
Ah yes, I posted before reading the spoiler. :smile:
Well, I intentionally put that detail inside the spoiler as a natural experiment for whether the UI is sufficiently intuitive.
Edit history for Spoilers also needs to be fixed. Right now you only see the initial "banner", and nothing about the changes to it's contents.

This looks shiny, at least in the webapp so far. I note there was the idea of using <details> in #15414. If ZT moves for an implementation, should we work on the principle of the current approach, or may things change a little?
/me adds spoilers to his edit history to-do list.

Vinit Singh said:

Edit history for Spoilers also needs to be fixed. Right now you only see the initial "banner", and nothing about the changes to it's contents.

Can you confirm what needs to be fixed? You can click on the banner to expand it and see the changes highlighted (example message); are you suggesting that it should be open by default in the edit history modal? @Vinit Singh
At the time, there was no content inside the spoiler I believe. That comment is a little old so I'm not sure about the details. Sorry :sweat_smile:

Ah, I think I see what happened. I did check, and I don't believe there was any edit history-specific change related to spoilers between when you posted your comment and now. However, I just realized that the spoiler banners in the edit history modal don't show the arrow button, and something that did change between then and now is that the entire banner is now a click target.

So the major bug is fixed, but the minor bug of missing the arrow still exists. Also, the cursor doesn't change when hovering over the banners in the modal. I'll add those to my list.

Thanks. :smile:
@Cyphase this is likely an issue of whether we run rendered_markdown.js in the edit history modal.
Makes sense; I noticed that the button element is added to the initial message data on the client side (which also makes sense).
Spoiler alert: we don't. I filed this as #16029.
